meanings.definition: One who hogs or monopolizes something.
meanings.sent1: The hogger at the party kept all the snacks to himself.
meanings.sent2: Don't be a hogger and share the toys with your friends.
meanings.sent3: The hogger of the remote control refused to let anyone else choose the channel.
meanings.sent4: She was a hogger of attention, always wanting to be the center of everyone's focus.
meanings.sent5: The greedy hogger grabbed all the cookies before anyone else could have one.

meanings.definition: A machine or device that hogs or cuts wood.
meanings.sent1: The lumberjack used the hogger to cut through the thick tree trunk.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter's workshop had a powerful hogger for shaping the wooden planks.
meanings.sent3: The old hogger in the shed had been used by generations of woodworkers.
meanings.sent4: The hogger roared to life, slicing through the logs with ease.
meanings.sent5: The hogger's sharp blades made quick work of the timber, creating smooth cuts.

meanings.sent1: The experienced hogger skillfully guided the train through the winding tracks.
meanings.sent2: The hogger checked the engine before starting the locomotive's journey.
meanings.sent3: The hogger waved cheerfully from the train's window as it departed the station.
meanings.sent4: The hogger's steady hand on the throttle kept the train running smoothly.
meanings.sent5: The dedicated hogger knew every lever and dial on the locomotive's control panel.
